abstract: Murders of transgender women in Argentina highlight contrast between country's liberal civil rights laws and its ingrained cultural resistance to nontraditional gender identities; gay and transgender activists, plagued by low life expectancy and unemployment, push for formal criminalizaton of discrimination against them.
lead_paragraph: Recent unsolved killings of transgender women have jolted Argentina, which has introduced some of the most liberal civil rights legislation in Latin America.

headline.main: Transgender Argentines Confront Continued Murder and Discrimination
headline.print_headline: Killings of Transgender Argentines Test a Nation’s Liberal Laws

snippet: Recent unsolved killings of transgender women have jolted Argentina, which has introduced some of the most liberal civil rights legislation in Latin America.
